Summary: 8 objects zigzaged across the Phoenix skies
divs: sighting details10\07\2013 i woke at approximately 4:30 a.m. to go outside to view the stars. as i was looking around i noticed a bright light moving across the sky. it looked similar to a satellite but i was not sure what it was. then i saw another and another and more. below is a culmination of less then 1 hour of viewing the skies and the total amount of these so-called satellites i viewed. at 04:47 a.m. i had been looking through my 10 x 50 bushnell binoculars above me. i was facing south the entire time and noticed an object looking like a satellite come into view. it was moving from the northwest towards the southeast. it stayed relatively straight from that point on where i lost it about 45 degrees above the southeastern horizon. at 04:50 a.m. again looking straight up, i noticed a bright object moving from the north to the towards the south. the object was lost at the southern horizon. at 04:52 a.m. i was looking around for more objects when another came into view moving from the north towards the south where i lost it just above the southern horizon. at 05:05 a.m. i noticed another bright object that came into view moving from the north towards the south where i lost it just above the southern horizon again. at 05:12 a.m. i noticed another bright object that came into view moving from the south towards the north where i lost it just above the northern horizon this time. at 05:18 a.m. i noticed another bright object that came into view moving from the south towards the north where i lost it just above the northern horizon this time. at 05:20 a.m. i noticed another bright object that came into view moving from the north towards the south this time where i lost it just above the southern horizon again. at 05:30 a.m. i noticed another bright object that came into view this time moving from the west towards the east where i lost it above the eastern horizon. so within 43 minutes, in the early morning hours of monday october 7th, 2013, there were 8 objects flying every which way crisscrossing the phoenix skies. they all had the characterization of looking like satellites going across the skies. none of the objects were the same colors. some light blue, some yellow, some white in color. none seemed to be the same size either. some larger and some smaller. the speed was not consistent, each moving at it's own speed across the sky. some fast some slow. none though were as fast as a meteorite. no object changed directions either. what ever way they were pointing when i first observed them is the direction they kept going until i lost sight of them below the horizon. there were several high flying airplanes and a helicopter flying at the same time too.
trends: There have been 417 other sightings in Phoenix
There were no other sightings in Phoenix on or around October 7th 2013
